str2: From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and erchomai; to come down.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
